meanings.definition: The act of making a general statement that is too broad and not based on specific evidence.
meanings.sent1: Her overgeneralization about all cats being mean was proven wrong when she met a friendly one.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned against overgeneralization when drawing conclusions from the survey results.
meanings.sent3: His overgeneralization that all vegetables taste bad made his friends laugh at his picky eating habits.
meanings.sent4: The overgeneralization that all teenagers are rebellious is not always true; some are quite responsible.
meanings.sent5: The overgeneralization that all birds can fly was shattered when he saw an ostrich running on the ground.

meanings.definition: A generalization that is made without considering exceptions or individual differences.
meanings.sent1: The overgeneralization that all students love pizza overlooks those who prefer other foods.
meanings.sent2: Avoiding overgeneralization is important in understanding the diverse opinions of the group.
meanings.sent3: Her overgeneralization that all boys hate dancing was proven wrong when she saw one enjoying it.
meanings.sent4: The overgeneralization that all snakes are dangerous overlooks the harmless ones kept as pets.
meanings.sent5: The overgeneralization that all flowers are colorful neglects the beauty of white lilies.
